abstract: A growing number of entrepreneurs in China, unable to make payments to illegal lenders, have gone into hiding to avoid physical harm or family dishonor; underground lenders are routinely used by private businessmen because government-run banks typically lend only to state-run corporations.
snippet: A growing number of entrepreneurs in China, unable to make payments to illegal lenders, have gone into hiding to avoid physical harm or family dishonor.
lead_paragraph: A growing number of entrepreneurs in China, unable to make payments to illegal lenders, have gone into hiding to avoid physical harm or family dishonor.

headline.main: In Cooling China, Loan Sharks Come Knocking
headline.print_headline: In Cooling China, Loan Sharks Come Knocking
headline.seo: Loan Sharks Terrorize Chinese Businesses as Economy Cools
